result.title: Chiral surfaces
result.description: Deliverable Study of chiral surfaces reportDelivered by UOXFThe team from University of Crete UOC has a long experience in the preparation and characterization of functionalized surfaces Chiral characterization of such samples however is not possible since the weak signals nrad are out of reach for the current stateoftheart In this deliverable 18 the UOC group will create functionalized chiral surfaces and the UOXF group will characterize them using the CCP methods discussed throughout ULTRACHIRAL

result.title: Micro-sample analysis
result.description: Deliverable Microsample analysis reportDelivered by UOCThe sensitivity enhancement offered by the CCP methods discussed in ULTRACHIRAL allow chiral characterization in a smaller scale which is very relevant for biological medical and forensic applications In this deliverable we will demonstrate this capability by incorporating a custom microfluidic cell constructed by UOXF to a CCP setup The targeted sensitivity is close to 1ngml

result.title: Portable CCP prototype
result.description: Deliverable Portable CCP prototypeDelivered by JGUThe CCP method incorporates a series of signal reversals which allow backgroundfree chiral detection without the need to remove the chiral sample This characteristic make the CCP method particularly suitable for field studies where the sample removal is either difficult or impossible Thus in this deliverable the JGU group will develop and test a standalone portable prototype which will be used for field studies of chiral emissions see deliverable 23

result.title: Technology showcase
result.description: The dissemination activities aim to maximise impact while controlling confidentiality to protect partners IP interests These actions are broadly classified in 2 target audiences 1 industrialtechnological sector and 2 pure research and public audience The former actions will be coordinated by CTECH while the latter are overseen by CNR The knowledge and skills developed within the project will be exploited to promote technology transfer to targeted industrial sectors
